task_summary: Pick if needed and precisely place a small grid clamp onto the workstation board, then release and retreat safely. [web:7][web:2]

task_long_description.overview: The scene shows a cobot at the DLR SARA workstation manipulating small dark grid clamps over a wooden or rail board surface. [web:7] The goal is to place a grid clamp at an aligned position on the board with correct yaw and gentle seating before opening the gripper. [web:7] The execution is organized as a BehaviorTree.CPP v3 XML sequence with a fallback to ensure the clamp is in hand before placing. [web:2][web:5] The tree performs perception, approach and alignment, contactâ€‘guided lowering, placement, release, and retreat to conclude the episode. [web:2][web:7]
preconditions: Workstation board and grid clamps are present and reachable within the robot workspace. [web:7]
Perception can detect the clamp and board features or rails for alignment. [web:7]
BehaviorTree.CPP v3 runtime is available to execute the XML tree structure. [web:2]
stepwise_plan: If the clamp is already grasped, skip picking; otherwise scan, detect, approach, compute a top grasp, pick, verify stability, and lift. [web:2][web:7]
Set tool yaw for board alignment, then scan and detect the grid board target region. [web:2][web:7]
Move above the board, approach and align with tight tolerance to match rail or hole pattern. [web:7]
Lower slowly until contact at low force to seat the clamp. [web:7]
Place on surface with specified yaw and press force, open gripper, retreat, and wait briefly. [web:2][web:7]
success_criteria: Clamp is released and stably seated at the intended board location with correct yaw. [web:7]
No excessive force or collisions during approach, contact, or release. [web:2]
End effector retreats to a safe clearance after release. [web:2]
failure_and_recovery: If object not detected, repeat scan and detection before proceeding. [web:2]
If grasp unstable, regrasp by recomputing pose and retrying pick. [web:2]
If alignment fails or contact not detected, re-approach with tighter tolerance or adjust yaw. [web:2][web:7]
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the clamp is placed on the board, gripper opened, and the tool has retreated to a safe distance. [web:2][web:7]

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible, indicating seating of the clamp against the board surface. [web:7]
frame_3.predicts_next: push or press actuation then gripper release is expected immediately after confirmed contact. [web:7]
frame_3.uncertainty_reduction: high because contact cues remove pose ambiguity and validate alignment. [web:2][web:7]

node_specs.description: Checks whether the clamp is already held to skip the pick sub-sequence. [web:2]
Searches for the clamp with a grid pattern scan before detection. [web:2][web:7]
Runs object detection to localize the clamp for grasping. [web:7]
Computes a top grasp pose and stores it to the blackboard. [web:2]
Executes the pick using the computed top grasp. [web:2]
Approaches the board and aligns to the rail or hole pattern with tight tolerance. [web:7]
Lowers slowly until contact to gently seat the clamp. [web:7]
Places the clamp on the board at the desired yaw with light press force. [web:7]
Releases the clamp by opening the gripper to the specified width. [web:2]
Backs off to a safe clearance after release to complete the cycle. [web:2]

failure_modes: Clamp not detected or occluded leading to perception failure. [web:7]
Grasp instability causing slip during transfer. [web:2]
Misalignment with board holes or rails preventing seating. [web:7]
recovery_strategy: Repeat scan and detection with limited attempts before abort. [web:2]
Recompute grasp pose and retry pick after opening gripper. [web:2]
Re-approach with adjusted yaw and tighter tolerance, then attempt contact again. [web:2][web:7]
assumptions: Frames depict the arm already near the board and likely holding a clamp; the BT includes a fallback pick in case the clamp is not in hand. [web:7]
Placement target is a board or rail grid area consistent with SARA workstation clamps. [web:7]
BehaviorTree.CPP v3 XML semantics are used for execution on a robotics stack. [web:2]

expected_success_criteria: Clamp is placed at aligned pose, released, and robot retreats without collision. [web:7][web:2]
